title: Utilizing soft systems thinking in higher education: SSM-based problem-solving strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational systems thinking and experience in higher education administration
context.additional_context: Blended course for undergraduate science students conducting project-based learning in limited-technology environments (smartphone-centric).

learning_goals: Learners can analyze complex higher education problems using SSM core concepts (rich pictures, activity models, etc.)
Learners can construct system models integrating diverse stakeholder perspectives and derive improvement strategies
Learners can establish action plans to resolve real-world science education program issues by applying SSM-based collaborative processes

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
